content.title: Vascular Surgery: Specialty Definition and Scope
content.summary: Vascular surgery is the surgical specialty dedicated to the diagnosis and treatment of diseases affecting the arterial, venous, and lymphatic systems, excluding the coronary and intracranial vessels.

training_pathway.traditional: General surgery residency (5 years) + Vascular fellowship (2 years)
training_pathway.integrated: Integrated vascular surgery residency (5 years, 0+5 or 4+2)
training_pathway.certification: American Board of Surgery (ABS) - Vascular Surgery Certificate

definition.@value: Surgical specialty treating diseases of the arterial, venous, and lymphatic systems, excluding coronary and intracranial vessels

learning_objectives: Define the scope of vascular surgery as a specialty
Differentiate vascular surgery from cardiac surgery and neurosurgery
List the major disease categories treated by vascular surgeons
Describe open, endovascular, and hybrid treatment modalities
clinical_pearls: Vascular surgery has evolved from predominantly open surgery to >50% endovascular procedures
Integrated vascular residency programs produce more fellowship-trained vascular surgeons
Dialysis access is a high-volume, critical service provided by vascular surgeons
Trauma coverage remains an essential component of vascular surgery practice
